title: Reformation's 25% Off Sale Is Here - Shop Editor-Favorite Picks
description: Reformation is a brand that's hard not to know. The sustainable Los Angeles-based fashion label is adored by the likes of Kendall Jenner, Meghan Markle, and Taylor Swift - along with countless others, including PS editors, and most likely, you. The brand's repertoire isn't known for just one thing. While its dresses are the ultimate fan favorite, Reformation's influence stretches far beyond that, with must haves in every category, from tops and bottoms to footwear, accessories, jewelry, and even the bestselling, '90s-inspired Cary jeans. But with price tags that mostly land in the three-dollar-sign range, a full Reformation shopping spree isn't always realistic. That's why we're all about choosing the right pieces, and why we've curated this guide to the brand's bestsellers for every Reformation lover, new or seasoned. Plus, lucky for us, Reformation is currently hosting a sale, with 25 percent off some of the label's cutest pieces. Ahead, we've rounded up the 17 best Reformation pieces to covet, from everyday dresses that'll take you from the office to happy hour to wedding guest dresses to tops that are perfect for layering. We even included options at a range of price points, along with PS editor favorites, styles in trending prints, and more. Keep scrolling to shop our sale selects.
author: Marisa Petrarca

While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Reformation is a brand that's hard not to know. The sustainable Los Angeles-based fashion label is adored by the likes of Kendall Jenner, Meghan Markle, and Taylor Swift — along with countless others, including PS editors, and most likely, you. The brand's repertoire isn't known for just one thing. While its dresses are the ultimate fan favorite, Reformation's influence stretches far beyond that, with must haves in every category, from tops and bottoms to footwear, accessories, jewelry, and even the bestselling, '90s-inspired Cary jeans.

But with price tags that mostly land in the three-dollar-sign range, a full Reformation shopping spree isn't always realistic. That's why we're all about choosing the right pieces, and why we've curated this guide to the brand's bestsellers for every Reformation lover, new or seasoned. Plus, lucky for us, Reformation is currently hosting a sale, with 25 percent off some of the label's cutest pieces.

Ahead, we've rounded up the 17 best Reformation pieces to covet, from everyday dresses that'll take you from the office to happy hour to wedding guest dresses to tops that are perfect for layering. We even included options at a range of price points, along with PS editor favorites, styles in trending prints, and more. Keep scrolling to shop our sale selects.

Best Cashmere Tank From Reformation

Reformation Reese Cashmere Tank ($111, originally $148)

This sleeveless fitted cashmere top is the kind of wardrobe staple you'll want in every color. Its luxurious fabric pairs perfectly with everything, from baggy jeans to skirts and beyond.

Best Going-Out Top From Reformation

Reformation Melanie Top ($111, originally $148)

We probably don't need to tell you how obsession-worthy this top is. Whether you're wearing it on a date night or out dancing with friends, it's guaranteed to turn heads and spark questions about where you got it. It also comes in neutrals like the black and white option ($148).

Best Silk Pants From Reformation

Reformation Olina Silk Pant ($149, originally $198)

This might be one of the best silk pant silhouettes we've seen out there, and that says a lot. It's perfect for a day at the office or a night out, thanks to its luxe fabric and relaxed fit.

Best Woven Dress From Reformation

Reformation Kerrie Dress ($149, originally $198)

Another iconic dress from Reformation, this brown midi stands out for summer and is perfect for both day and night. Teamed with kitten heels and a clutch, it's both breezy and stylish.

Best Denim Dress From Reformation

Reformation Kendi Denim Midi Dress ($164, originally $218)

Narrowing down the best of Reformation's iconic dresses is no easy task, but this denim midi stands out. Teamed with a belt, boots, and your favorite handbag, it's without a doubt double-take-worthy.

Best Linen Dress From Reformation

Reformation Frankie Linen Dress ($186, originally $248)

This might be the one dress we'd definitely pack for our summer trips, as linen is the perfect fabric for warm weather. We love this tomato-red color, but it also comes in black and light blue.

Best Strappy Sandals From Reformation

Reformation Serenity Bare Sandals ($186, originally $248)

This red kitten heel might be one of our new summer favorites. It's not only cute but also comfortable, thanks to the straps that keep your feet securely in place. Paired with a dress or jeans, it adds the perfect pop of color to complete any outfit.

Best Swimsuit Bottom From Reformation

Reformation Faro Bikini Bottom ($98)

Reformation revamped its swimwear line, and PS editors were among the first to test them out. While all pieces in the collection are covetable for any vacations you're taking, this one stands out for its chic, retro-inspired design. Check this one out and more in our review of Reformation swimwear.

Editor Quote: "As a city girl, I take my beach days seriously. I typically like to spend hours by the water, so my swimwear has to be comfortable to lay and tan in all day, and hold up for frequent dips in the ocean. This retro-inspired swim set passed the test and more, making it one of my favorite pieces of swimwear to date. The brand's new eco fabric felt both soft and stretchy, and the halter neckline made the suit very sunbathing-friendly, though it's worth noting it may lack support for those with larger chests (it has no underwire or molded cups). It also changed my mind about swim bottoms — I usually prefer a high-cut style, but I found these boy shorts to be so flattering and fun." — Yerin Kim, former editor, Features

Best Earrings From Reformation

Reformation x Clare Waight Keller Bechet Earrings ($168)

Reformation dropped its first-ever limited-edition, vintage-inspired jewelry collection, created in collaboration with fashion designer Clare Waight Keller. These sleek huggie hoops with bold geometric links are one of our favorites from the collection.

Best Cashmere Sweater From Reformation

Reformation Cashmere Boyfriend Sweater ($178)

If you're always ready to invest in a cashmere sweater, you can't go wrong with this Reformation bestseller. It's soft, lightweight, boasts a relaxed fit, and comes in both solids and stripes. We love that it's made from 95 percent recycled cashmere, too. What's not to love?

Best Jeans From Reformation

Reformation Cary Low Rise Slouchy Wide Leg Jeans ($178)

Reformation's Cary jeans are a fan-favorite among shoppers, and occasionally the brand comes out with on-trend versions for the season, like this vented and studded pair ($218). There's also a leopard-print pair ($198), if that's more your style. Read more in our Reformation Cary Jeans review.

Editor Quote:: "As someone who's 5'1", I do wish the Cary came in a petite variation — but in my opinion, that's all that's missing here. Everything else — from the comfort to the subtle stretch to the eco-friendly production method — is truly top notch when it comes to nailing the perfect baggy jean." — Sarah Wasilak, associate content director, Shopping

Best Cardigan From Reformation

Reformation Clara Cashmere Crew Cardigan ($198)

This classically chic cardigan comes in a rainbow of colors, including neutrals and bolder hues. And like the aforementioned boyfriend sweater, it's made from 95 percent recycled cashmere with a relaxed fit.

Best Wedding Guest Dress From Reformation

Reformation Isa Knit Dress ($218)

Equally alluring with or without a belt, the Isa dress is on-trend with a wavy, plunging neckline and hardware that shapes and structures. While it's long and formfitting, making it appropriate for a black tie event, adding a belt or printed shoes can help dress it down for cocktail attire. Like many Ref pieces, it's also made from deadstock fabric and is dry clean only.

Editor Quote: "As someone who loves wearing color at weddings, I've never been so excited to wear all-black — or blown away by the compliments that ensued. It's also extremely comfortable and stretchy, which is in part thanks to the adjustable straps. As someone who's 5'1", I was pleased by the ankle length that allowed for a shoe moment. And while I chose platforms, I could've easily gotten away with a kitten heel." — SW

Best Special Occasion Dress From Reformation

Reformation Bryson Dress ($248)

If you need a special occasion dress, rest assured that Reformation has you covered. While you could easily spend an afternoon scrolling through all of the brand's elegant options, this beauty is a standout with its fitted bodice and A-line skirt. It's available in this eye-catching shade of cherry red and three floral prints.

Best Suede Bag From Reformation

Reformation Medium Patrizia Bag ($448)

Suede bags are a classic no matter the season, and this brown structured bowling bag is certainly no exception. It has silver hardware, a card holder, and zippered closure, but if that doesn't sound like enough room, there's a bigger version, too: the Oversized Patrizia Bag ($598). It's big enough to store a laptop and more.

— Additional reporting by Sarah Wasilak and Balim Tezel

Marisa Petrarca (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping and has over seven years of experience writing and editing beauty, fashion, and lifestyle content. She was previously the senior beauty editor at Grazia USA and the style and beauty editor at Us Weekly. Now freelancing, her work has been featured in Cosmopolitan, Allure, Marie Claire, and more.

Sarah Wasilak (she/her) is the PS Shopping Director. With plenty of experience in the fashion industry and over 11 years as an editor at the brand, she enjoys writing and creating social videos across the lifestyle, health, and fitness categories. She is the host of the "Dinner for Shoes" podcast and has bylines at InStyle, Elle, Refinery29, Who What Wear, Elite Daily, Byrdie, and The Quality Edit.

Balim Tezel (she/her) is a shopping updates editor at PS and the founder of Maison des Nus, a New York-based affordable luxury brand. She graduated from Northwestern University's Medill School of Journalism.
